description:
### 11.73 dnn_detect

Do object detection with deep neural networks.

The filter accepts the following options:

**dnn_backend**

    Specify which DNN backend to use for model loading and execution. This option accepts only openvino now, tensorflow backends will be added. 

**model**

    Set path to model file specifying network architecture and its parameters. Note that different backends use different file formats. 

**input**

    Set the input name of the dnn network. 

**output**

    Set the output name of the dnn network. 

**confidence**

    Set the confidence threshold (default: 0.5). 

**labels**

    Set path to label file specifying the mapping between label id and name. Each label name is written in one line, tailing spaces and empty lines are skipped. The first line is the name of label id 0 (usually it is ’background’), and the second line is the name of label id 1, etc. The label id is considered as name if the label file is not provided. 

**backend_configs**

    Set the configs to be passed into backend. To use async execution, set async (default: set). Roll back to sync execution if the backend does not support async.
name: dnn_detect

options.description: Specify which DNN backend to use for model loading and execution. This option accepts only openvino now, tensorflow backends will be added.
options.name: dnn_backend

options.description: Set path to model file specifying network architecture and its parameters. Note that different backends use different file formats.
options.name: model

options.description: Set the input name of the dnn network.
options.name: input

options.description: Set the output name of the dnn network.
options.name: output

options.description: Set the configs to be passed into backend. To use async execution, set async (default: set). Roll back to sync execution if the backend does not support async.
options.name: backend_configs

options.description: use DNN async inference (ignored, use backend_configs='async=1')
options.name: async

options.description: Set path to label file specifying the mapping between label id and name. Each label name is written in one line, tailing spaces and empty lines are skipped. The first line is the name of label id 0 (usually it is ’background’), and the second line is the name of label id 1, etc. The label id is considered as name if the label file is not provided.
options.name: labels
